citations.narrative:
The Jacobs sheep enclosure is not in good repair. The front side of the primary enclosure fence has broken projecting
wires at the level of the animals' head/face. The fencing on the left has large gaping areas that the sheep can place the
entire head through. One of the sheep was sticking his nose through the fence near the broken wires at the time of
inspection. Failure to maintain enclosure fencing can cause sharp points to serve as a source of entrapment or injury to
the animals face and eyes.
Correct by ensuring fences are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals.
Correct by July 19, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The Jacobs sheep enclosure is not in good repair. The front side of the primary enclosure fence has broken projecting 
wires at the level of the animals' head/face. The fencing on the left has large gaping areas that the sheep can place the 
entire head through. One of the sheep was sticking his nose through the fence near the broken wires at the time of 
inspection. Failure to maintain enclosure fencing can cause sharp points to serve as a source of entrapment or injury to 
the animals face and eyes. 
 
Correct by ensuring fences are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to 
contain the animals. 
 
Correct by July 19, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
